history.text: Hello
Did you see the first Iron Man movie that came out in 2008?
Yes. I did! I really liked the special effects of the movie. Did you?
Yeah it was a good first installment in the series.
Robert Downey Jr. was a perfect fit as Tony Stark.
Yes. I was going to say the same. He played a great role as Stark and the way he ran Stark Industries in the movie.
He just seemed like how I imagined the character.
The beginning of the movie helped with learning about how Iron Man was invented.
Yeah, I think they handled that well. Sometimes movies can rush an origin story.
Exactly. What did you think about Stark's personal assistant, Pepper Potts?
While I don't like Gweyneth Paltrow, as an actress she was convincing as her character.
She was. I thought she was very serious about her role as Pepper Potts and very organized. Though, I never realized she would be a potential love interest for Stark.
That did seem odd given Stark's personality, but the character needed an arc.
What did you think about the sound quality? I think it made Iron Man come to life. The special effects is what I liked the most.
I'm no audiophile, but I did like the visual effects. That's a big reason why I see this kind of movie for the escapism.
Yes. Just watching the visual effects is great.
The do NEED some kind of a story though. I didn't like the transformer movies.

I thought the same. Iron Man 2008 movie was the start of great sequels if they would have focused more on just
 Iron Man.
The scene in Afghanistan really impressed me. Where the doctor helped bring Iron Man to life.
What do you think?
That's what made it a little better than your average comic book movie.
It felt more real.
or like it could be real
Yes. I found it surprising Agent Phil Coulson of S.H.I.E.L.D appeared in the movie. That was the start to his career I think.
Probably, this was one of the earlier marvel movies.
Would you watch this movie again? It was rated pretty good on Rotten Tomatoes.
Yeah I'd watch it again
I think it will hold up over time better than some of the other marvel movies
I agree. I noticed Stark kept his secret of being Iron Man for quite some time in the movie.
Yeah right up until the end.
It was fitting for his character.
but an overall bad idea
Yes. I agree.
It would have been more exciting in the sequel if he would have not revealed his identity. What do you think?
Definitely, I don't remember the sequels very well, but I didn't like them a lot.
What would you rate the movie? I myself would rate the movie as a 8/10. Only because I did not get bored watching it.

uid1response.feedback: I love everything Marvel. So I enjoy talking about Marvel movies.
